summary: This document is an email chain from July 2019 between attorney Bruce Barket and a Supervisory Staff Attorney at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding Bruce Barket's client, Nicholas Tartaglione. The emails discuss scheduling a legal visit, concerns about leaked information to the press regarding Tartaglione's potential questioning about Jeffrey Epstein, and the MCC's response that the matter is under an open investigation.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing Nicholas Tartaglione. He is communicating with MCC staff to schedule a legal visit and expressing concerns about false information being leaked about his client in relation to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Client of attorney Bruce Barket, incarcerated at the MCC. The emails reference a news story suggesting he was questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at the facility.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of a news story alleging that Nicholas Tartaglione was questioned about a possible attack on him while both were held at the MCC.

persons.name: Tracy Connor
persons.context: Executive editor who contacted Bruce Barket seeking confirmation for an NBC news story about Tartaglione and Epstein.

connections.description: Bruce Barket is the legal representative for inmate Nicholas Tartaglione, as shown by his scheduling of visits and advocacy on Tartaglione's behalf.
A news story, referenced in the email, suggests Tartaglione was questioned about a possible attack on fellow inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC.

events.title: Scheduling of Legal Visit for Tartaglione
events.description: Attorney Bruce Barket requests to see his client, Nicholas Tartaglione, at the MCC first thing in the morning.

events.title: MCC Acknowledges Open Investigation
events.description: A Supervisory Staff Attorney at the MCC informs Bruce Barket that matters concerning his client are part of an open investigation, limiting what can be discussed.

events.title: Alleged Leak of False Information
events.description: Bruce Barket complains to the MCC that false information about his client Nicholas Tartaglione, potentially related to Jeffrey Epstein, has been leaked to the press.

locations: New York Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Attorney Bruce Barket was actively representing Nicholas Tartaglione, who was incarcerated at the MCC in July 2019.
A news story from NBC, referenced in the emails, alleged that Tartaglione was questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC.
The MCC Supervisory Staff Attorney confirmed an open investigation was ongoing regarding the matter, preventing the sharing of information.
Bruce Barket alleged that false information about his client had been leaked from the MCC facility to the press.
